bibl.title: Despatch from Ezekiel E. Smith to Alvey A. Adee, January 3, 1890
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consular General
U.S. Second Assistant Secretary of State

div1.p: Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 3rd, 1890
Mer. Ezekiel E. Smith To the Deartment of State.
Last WIll and Testament of Mers. Alice Fuller
Consulate General of the United States, Monrovia, Liberia, January 3rd, 1890
Honorable Alvey A. Adee, Second Assistant Secretary, Washington, D.C.

Sir: I have the honor respectfully to acknowledge the receipt of your No. 9. Despatch of November 16th 1889, instructing me to procure a copy of the "Last Will and Testament" of Alice Fuller, who died in this city in the month of June 1888.
I am, sir, your obedient servant,
Ezekiel E. Smith U.S. Consul General
Enclosures One. Copy of the Last Will and Testament of Mers Fuller.

In the name of God Amen I Alice Fuller of the City of Monrovia County of Mentserrad, and the Republic of Liberia being of Sound disposing mind but feeble in body do make public and declare this to be my Last Will and Testament in Mannes allowing.

After all my just debts and funneral expenses are paid, I give and leave my half lot on Broad Street in the city of Monrovia to Clara Fuller Weaver wife of Kincoln Napolion Weaver. to her and her heirs forever, free from all control or disposal of her husband. to have and to hold the same to her and her heirs forever. and I give and devise to Mrs Sarah J Woods wife of Tyson Woods of Cape Palmas, one of my Town Lots located if one collection in the town of Greenville Senoe County to have and to hold to her and her heirs forever ____ and I give an devise the other two lots located in said Greenville, one to my dear friend Emma A. Cooper and the other to my dear friend Sarah C. Yates to have and to hold the said prperty to each in Severalty to them and their heris I give and bequeath to Benjamin V. R. Melville, all my and Tethle to the house in Front Street in Monrovia that yours now having built and I also give and bequeath to him two hundred dollars in order to help him to finish siad house-- (over).

4 I have Several orders coming out from America and England and when they come and are disposed of I give and bequeath an equal share of the proceeds to the Saia B. V. R. Melville Arna U. Fuller his mother, my friend Sarah C. Yates, and my friend Marla Q Pervell's and a Rationof said proceeds I wish to go to my friend Mrs Braxton Bath fifty six dollars of the money in these orders belong to Anna W. Fuller and the above devision of proceeds cannot be made until after her said money are deducted out
